text.section: In this section, "clerical error" means an inadvertent mistake in a voter registration record made by an election official.
The State Administrator or an election director shall make the determination whether an error in a voter registration record is a clerical error.

If the State Administrator or election director determines that a clerical error has been made, the State Administrator or election director shall:
cause the error to be corrected; and
promptly notify the voter of the correction.

section.section: On election day, if it is alleged that the name of a registered voter is missing from the precinct register because of a clerical error, the chief election judge shall contact the State Board or local board to determine whether a clerical error has been made.

If the State Administrator or election director determines that the absence of the name from the precinct register is the result of a clerical error, the State Administrator or election director shall authorize the chief election judge to:
issue a blank voter authority card to the affected voter; and
allow the affected voter to vote after the affected voter completes the voter authority card and provides any other documentation required by the State Board.
